50 ELECTRIC CAR OWNERS "BUMPING IN GEAR" WITH SOLAR BATTERY PACK: 11,000KM/YEAR WITHOUT LOST 1 PENNY OF ELECTRICITY COST

A Tesla electric car owner in the US built a solar battery pack, placed on the roof of his Tesla Model Y, allowing him to travel more than 11,000km/year without having to pay any costs for maintenance. charge.

üåû BETA ONE - SOLAR ENERGY SOLUTIONS:

Device Kit Name: Beta One.
Average Performance: Charge more than 32km per day with 5 hours outdoors.
Maximum Performance (Estimated): Can charge approximately 64km in 5 hours (best weather conditions).
Electric Dong Hoa Distance: Nearly 11,700km/year (32km/day).
üöó NO ELECTRICITY COST FOR DAILY TRAVEL:

With Beta One, car owners can travel daily distances without paying electricity fees.
Suppose an office user charges 32km per day, a total of 11,700km/year.

üîç CURRENT REALITY:

Many car manufacturers have equipped their vehicles with solar batteries, but the efficiency is low. (For example, Fisker Ocean can collect about 8km/day).
üåê MORE INFORMATION:

Beta One is in the process of development, hoping to be commercialized for about 4,000 USD (more than 98 million VND).
Beta One weighs nearly 75kg, which can increase energy consumption and affect vehicle aerodynamics.
üöÄ EXPERT COMMENTS:
"This is a breakthrough in utilizing solar energy for electric vehicles. If Beta One can be successfully commercialized, this could be a great motivation for users to switch to electric vehicles." - Quang Hieu.
